tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Dream Gardens
programme.desc: After tragically losing their wife and mother to cancer, Roberto and his children are hoping that the transformation of their garden will not only bring them healing but also create an everlasting tribute to their loved one.

programme.title: Nigellas Christmas Kitchen
programme.desc: Nigella creates a roast pumpkin and sweet potato soup with a Stilton swirl, her home-made mincemeat and pies, and a lamb and date tagine which is wonderful to eat now or to store in the freezer for last minute guests.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigate the murder of a former childrens home resident. Meanwhile, Marlon sits his sergeants exams, and Selwyn meets his daughter for the first time.

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: In the Waitaki Valley, Michael and Olivia Pavelitch have their work cut out for them when they embark on breathing life into an historic rabbiters cottage whilst carefully preserving its 160-year history. (Final)

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.desc: Take a trip back to 1979 when Michael Parkinson interviews guests Paul Hogan and Frank Hardy.

programme.title: Nigella Bites
programme.desc: Nigella focuses on the kind of healthy food we all need to eat when we wish to purge ourselves of lifes impurities. Think salmon with greens and shiitake mushrooms and Vietnamese chicken and mint salad.

programme.title: Nigellas Christmas Kitchen
programme.desc: Nigella invites a few friends for a pre-Christmas brunch. Featuring a triple cheese and onion strata, a glazed and toasted vanilla cake brioche and an antioxidant fruit salad, which could come in handy for the weeks ahead!

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigate the murder of a water taxi driver at the same time as Neville receives an anonymous letter warning them a murder is due to take place.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Ladybug faces Ninos little brother, now Chris Master.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Because of a plan thought up by Marinette, Shadow Moth akumatizes two villains. Ladybug and Cat Noir will need help to stop the evil duo!

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Nurse Jane gets off to a bumpy start with Mamzelle when the second form get their hands on a box of tricks. Meanwhile, Darrells eagerness to play sports again lands her back in the San.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.sub-title: If You Cant Scooby-doo The Time, Dont Scooby Doo The Crime
programme.desc: A ghostly inmate haunts an inescapable prison.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its a scorching hot day on the farm and the Flock need to cool off. When Bitzer discovers the Sheep Dip is out of action the Flock have to come up with another plan.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors reveal how big your lungs would be if they were laid out flat and why you need to cough, and in Operation Takeover they find out what its like to work in the hospital canteen.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Your bodys largest organ is your skin - find out how it works and how to make your own homunculus!

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Maxs mum gets akumatized into Startrain. Now at the controls of a flying train, she wants to realise her dream of becoming an astronaut.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Shadow Moth creates Sentibubbler, a fearsome Sentimonster that will only stop if Rena Rouge betrays Ladybug and Cat Noir! Will our heroes pass this trust test?

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Suspect Sprinkler
programme.desc: When the timer on Mrs Maniacis sprinkler system is tampered with before the Garden of the Year; competition, the Inbestigators must track down the culprit.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.sub-title: The Sword, The Fox And The Scooby-doo!
programme.desc: The gang help Mark Hamill face a Fox Monster in Japan.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Bubbles goes on a road trip with the Professor.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer has a thrilling new hobby - however its not as easy as it looks! When the Farmer gets stuck in a tree Bitzer comes to his rescue, leaving Shaun and the Flock to get to grips with the airborne contraption.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors reveal why you need different shaped teeth to eat your food safely by wearing some very strange gnashers! Plus they find out what its like to be a lifeguard in Operation Takeover.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand are back in their kitchen lab! Did you know your body contains invisible ink! Find out how and make your own in todays DO tryexperiment.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Law And Disorder In Lagos
programme.desc: Louis Theroux explores Lagos in Nigeria, one of the fastest growing cities in the world. The city is changing so rapidly that formal structures of law and order cant keep pace with its population.

programme.title: Adam Hills: The Last Leg
programme.sub-title: Sara Pascoe, Munya Chawawa And Josh Pugh
programme.desc: Everything in the world doesnt seem ok right now, so turn to Adam, Josh and Alex plus guests Sara Pascoe, Munya Chawawa and Josh Pugh for a humorous look at the week and to answer your #IsItOk questions. (Season Final)

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Lilly struggles to focus on dance, and Ozzy tries to find Richelle the perfect venue.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Robin elects to become a cat so Starfire will love him.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Its villain report card day at Odd Squad.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: The Bears are reunited with their pet crab, Captain Craboo. But after an unfortunate run-in with Nom Nom, the Bears may lose their pet forever.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
programme.desc: Twilight is torn when she discovers the cruise she and her family are on, is a themed vacation experience in which ponies have paid for the privilege of spending time with her.

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.sub-title: Its A Wonderful Life Piper Part 2
programme.desc: With time running out and the fate of The Next Step in her hands, Piper struggles to reignite the love of dance in everyone.

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Ex-racing driver Tonys plans of doing up his 1970 Lotus Elan were dashed by a disabling spinal injury. With just a couple of years before a wheelchair beckons, can Tim and Fuzz fast track his project to completion? (Final)

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Solange Kardinaly, Christian Engblom, Antonio Martinez, and Ari Novick.

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: Ruth Evershed is approached by a council snooper who claims to have uncovered some dodgy covert activities.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: rage revisits the best of 2025s guest programmers, from Mallrat to Evan Dando, The Offspring, Ninajirachi, Paris Texas, Ruel, DIIV and more.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: The lost Beatles tapes have been found, and Edina is called in to host an event to celebrate. The moment comes to play the tapes, but they are not quite what anyone was expecting.

programme.title: Butterfly
programme.desc: In an attempt to understand and support Maxine, Vicky and Stephen attend a support group for gender nonconforming young people. The family attend their first appointment at the gender clinic, but Stephen still struggles.

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Kenzie auditions three dancers for the Nationals solo.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: After a defeat due to bad leg strength, the Titans work out.

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.sub-title: The Three Stooges Save Christmas Pt. 2
programme.desc: The kids accidentally destroy Chefs decorated Christmas tree. Scared this means theyve ruined his Christmas, they go on an epic mission to replace his holiday treasures.

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: In an attempt to win the holidays, Chef brings snowmen to life to entertain the kids. But when they turn out to be evil, Chef and the kids have to jingle some bells.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: The Baby Bears have an adventure in the sky while aboard a plane to Sweden. But when the baby Bears are forced to sit in different sections of the plane, things get a bit haywire for everyone on board.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
programme.desc: Wanting to help as many blank flanks as possible, the CMCs start a Cutie Mark Day Camp, but are surprised when one of their campers doesnt want a cutie mark!

programme.title: Wallace And Gromit: The Wrong Trousers
programme.sub-title: Have Yourself A Sardiney Little Christmas Parts 1 And 2
programme.desc: Wallace and Gromit are embroiled in a tale of skulduggery when a villainous penguin, posing as an innocent lodger, traps Wallace as an unwitting accomplice in a diamond heist. It is left to Gromit to save the day.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: The girls awake on Christmas Day, and find that Gwen is missing. Darrell heads out after her to the bus shelter! Once back at the school everyone, gathers together, singing cheerfully - the perfect Malory Towers Christmas.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil steps in to help sell a house for a family of horse-fans in Newcastle. Graham and Jane Hughes five-bed is situated in Gosforth - but despite its desirable postcode its been on the market for more than a year.

programme.title: Fisk
programme.desc: When Helen Tudor-Fisks life falls apart, she takes a job in a small suburban firm specialising in wills and probate assuming that, because the clients are dead she wont have to deal with people.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nubs plants a seed that grows out of control.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Ben and Holly set out in the Elf Submarine to try and rescue Redbeard the Elf Pirates sunken treasure. Mr Elf steers the Elf Submarine to the bottom of the lake but before they realise, they are gobbled up by Big Bad Barry.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos are in a hairdressers salon. They watch as the hairdresser puts all his signs outside the shop. Whilst the hairdresser is busy, the Twirlywoos decide to put everything outside... including the customers!

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: O and Miss Elaina are playing with her robot when O accidentally breaks it. O says sorry and helps Miss Elaina fix it.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig finds a spider in the house and orders Daddy Pig to get rid of it. Mr Skinny-Legs is set free in the garden, where he can spin all the webs he likes, wherever he likes.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington, Jonathan and Judy are playing imaginary games in the park. Judy goes to the half pipe with Mateo, but they decide they might have more fun playing with Paddington and Jonathan instead.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve and the presents have just been delivered to Father Christmas at the North Pole. Back at the elf tree, Mr Elf is sitting down to a nice cup of tea as Father Christmas rings up to say the toys are missing.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its finally the day of the babys arrival! Mummy and Daddy Pig rush to the hospital, but Peppa and George must stay with Granny and Grandpa Pig instead.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: A celebrity quokka visits Kangaroo Beach to film an episode of the smash hit TV series Wallaby Waters.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima, Big Lizard and Ammon are squabbling over Dads precious Explorer Notebook. When disaster strikes, only by working together can they save it from being lost forever!

programme.title: Play School: Interesting Insects
programme.desc: Did you see that insect? Michelle and Luke learn all about insects who can hide themselves in plain sight! Michelle and Luke create a caterpillar cafe in the Play School garden and Michelle flutters around like a butterfly.

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups go on a Pirate Hunt, looking for golden treasure but when they cant find any gold, will they end up empty handed?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing is getting ready to go to Sulas house but hes all sneezy and hot so Flop decides that Bing needs to stay home and keep his germs to himself.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mackenzie, Jack and Rusty are playing as astronauts on a mission to Mars. But Mackenzie keeps going missing and no one knows why!

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: Find out how to make a Jungle Jeep in South Africa; In the UK see if some hilarious headband ears can be made in under a minute and in Brazil a Mini Maker helps create a fabulous feathered-friend.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: Nia leads the gang in planning the annual Fall Farmers Market but, when no one shows up due to various "people moving" problems, she has to learn to adapt and figure out a new way for everyone to enjoy the special event.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig arrives in a new electric car. The family all go for a ride and are surprised when the car talks and sings!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the Baby Pea-Rexes help a young Cornasaurolophus reach the top of a hot volcano where the heat will make its kernels pop and allow a fresh new coat.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish and Bobby go into Rosas art studio, even though they arent meant to go in there without her. Tish then, accidently, knocks ink all over Rosas latest picture.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: After discovering giant footprints in the woods, the Dream Factory Crew goes on an adventurous search for the mythical Bigfoot creature.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Enemy Anemones
programme.desc: The Octonauts and some helpless crabs are caught between two territorial groups of aggregating anemones - and their numbers are growing!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Tino the artistic mouse is trying to paint a picture of Duggee but he cant get it right, which infuriates him no end. As he tells the Squirrels: seeking perfection is his whole philosophy.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Its time for the Big Pontypandy Talent Show! But when Elvis knocks a drink over the drone control panel, the drones crash land, causing many fires.

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Emma and Kaeng make a yummy carrot cake for Emmas birthday and have a surprise party with the toys! We see a family welcoming and celebrating a newborn baby and Through The Windows, we learn about Buddhas birthday.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: At playgroup, the children, Madame Gazelle and with the help of Granny Sheep, create a giant Christmas card full of messages, drawings, and gifts to say thanks to Father Christmas.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When it surprisingly snows Cosima decides it must be Christmas! Rex disrupts her festive preparations, but it doesnt stop the family having a perfect Proximas.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemma hosts a No Sleep Sleepover full of fun and games, but can the tired cadets make it until midnight?

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Romeo needs the PJs help bringing his Flying Factory under control, but they dont trust him.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Its the run up to Christmas, the Squirrels are over-excited and Duggee is attempting to keep it all under control.

programme.title: Tiddler
programme.desc: The story of a little fish with a big imagination who gets lost in the deep wide ocean until hes saved by his own storytelling.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nashs Jedi friends set out to find her missing speeder.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Everyone is visiting snooty King and Queen Marigolds Castle. King and Queen Marigold give them a tour which features a room made of ice sculptures and an upside down room.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos find themselves in a sports hall. They watch a gymnast dance whilst twirling a ribbon. Toodloo copies the gymnast, twirling a ribbon. Chickedy and Chick join in too.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Teddy is nervous for a boat ride on Trolley, but Daniel helps him to be brave! They enjoy the ride together.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds explore a fire truck and station! They see gear, practice drills, and ride out on a rescue run. Firefighters carry lots of gear and do many jobs beyond fighting fires!

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Mr Brown is taking the kids to the circus tonight but where are the tickets? Paddington and the kids must retrace his steps to find them but actually find out how thoughtful and caring Mr Brown really is.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The Elf Factory is deep down in the roots of The Great Elf Tree. It is almost Christmas time and the elves are busy making toys. When there is a problem with the toys a little bit of magic saves the day.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: With the baby now born, Peppa makes it her mission to find the perfect name. After many failed attempts, Peppa finally finds the perfect name with the help from the family album.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Frizzy and Gemma investigate the mysterious disappearance of several boats in Kangaroo Beachs Barramundi Triangle.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When a giant beetle steals D.O.R.I.S.s brain, thinking its a nut, Cosima and Big Lizard give chase through the forest. Big Lizards unique skills rescue poor D.O.R.I.S.s super-brain.

programme.title: Play School: Interesting Insects
programme.desc: Its a race between the fast Australian tiger beetle and the slow stick insect! Alex dresses up as a praying mantis for a party, and Michelle and Maurice go on an Interesting Insect safari!

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups go on an Easter Egg hunting adventure, but when Pockets finds all the eggs, can they find another way for them ALL to fill their baskets?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing is playing Hide and Seek at the creche with Sula, Pando and Coco. Bing doesnt go to the toilet before the game starts and when he needs to go before he is found he has to decide whether to give up his hiding spot.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo want Dad all to themselves until they discover he has some gross habits.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In Australia, discover if Mister Maker can make some googly eye glasses in a minute; in South Africa, find out what can be created from an old cookie cutter and in the UK, lots of Mini Makers build a terrific toy picture.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: Thomas is tapped to deliver a sealed, sweet-smelling boxcar. When he LOSES that boxcar, Thomas and his friends must use their sense of smell to track it down again.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its Christmas at Peppas house, and everyone is opening their presents. Peppa is so happy that she falls and hurts herself, and the whole family must go to the hospital.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: A Mandarinteryx has moved into homebase and is causing a big mess. In order to move it along, they have to find it a partner, and quickly.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Its Saturday afternoon and Tish and Pola have had to come to the supermarket at the busiest time. Both look a bit perturbed as they stand at the threshold of the sliding doors.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: Ms. Kashani leads a road rally where the Dream Factory Crew get to demonstrate their navigation skills, but when Drews overconfidence leads to Moose being stranded on a runaway vehicle, everyone has to help save the day.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Beluga Whales
programme.desc: When the Octonauts discover a pod of Beluga Whales stranded at a breathing hole, they use music to lead them to safety.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee has his Sharing Badge, and shows the Squirrels how to take something and divide it between everyone equally.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: All Mandy wants is to attract more bee visitors to her Bee Hotel than James - but she ends up starting a fire at the Watermill!

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Emma and Karen enjoy a berry cherry pudding and play a musical dancing game. Theres more music and dance Through The Windows as a family celebrate Vietnamese Lunar New Year, and we see a family choose a Christmas tree!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is Christmas and the children all visit Santas Grotto to tell him what they would like for Christmas.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale Of The Seed Snatch
programme.desc: When Mr McGregor fills a bird table with sunflower seeds, Squirrel Nutkin becomes dangerously obsessed with raiding it...

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: Jeremy and Deena need to sneak into the playroom and shut down Glitchs Noise Maker machine before it wakes cousin Milo from his afternoon nap.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The Elf Factory is deep down in the roots of The Great Elf Tree. It is almost Christmas time and the elves are busy making toys. When there is a problem with the toys a little bit of magic saves the day.

programme.title: Stick Man
programme.desc: Stick Man lives in the family tree with his Stick Lady Love and their stick children three but its dangerous being a Stick Man as a dog wants to play with him. Join Stick Man on his troublesome journey back to the family tree.

programme.title: Dream Gardens
programme.desc: After tragically losing their wife and mother to cancer, Roberto and his children are hoping that the transformation of their garden will not only bring them healing but also create an everlasting tribute to their loved one.

programme.title: Nigellas Christmas Kitchen
programme.desc: Nigella creates a roast pumpkin and sweet potato soup with a Stilton swirl, her home-made mincemeat and pies, and a lamb and date tagine which is wonderful to eat now or to store in the freezer for last minute guests.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigate the murder of a former childrens home resident. Meanwhile, Marlon sits his sergeants exams, and Selwyn meets his daughter for the first time.

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: In the Waitaki Valley, Michael and Olivia Pavelitch have their work cut out for them when they embark on breathing life into an historic rabbiters cottage whilst carefully preserving its 160-year history. (Final)

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.desc: Take a trip back to 1979 when Michael Parkinson interviews guests Paul Hogan and Frank Hardy.

programme.title: Nigella Bites
programme.desc: Nigella focuses on the kind of healthy food we all need to eat when we wish to purge ourselves of lifes impurities. Think salmon with greens and shiitake mushrooms and Vietnamese chicken and mint salad.

programme.title: Nigellas Christmas Kitchen
programme.desc: Nigella invites a few friends for a pre-Christmas brunch. Featuring a triple cheese and onion strata, a glazed and toasted vanilla cake brioche and an antioxidant fruit salad, which could come in handy for the weeks ahead!

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigate the murder of a water taxi driver at the same time as Neville receives an anonymous letter warning them a murder is due to take place.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: Meredith Sheehan presents the days top stories and latest news, including the Day of Reflection to honour the victims of the horrific terrorist attack at Bondi Beach and to stand in solidarity with the Jewish community.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: We continue our look back at some of the best Landline stories from 2025. A barramundi farming success in the Northern Territory, plus the impact of bird flu on egg farms and egg shortages.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Can you tell the difference between real and AI-generated videos? We put high schoolers to the test.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: Dangerous mission: a chaplain with Germanys Special Forces. Plus Austrians are debating how to deal with wolves.

programme.title: The Business: Summer Special
programme.desc: The superannuation sector on notice: how retirement savings have been put at risk. Plus regulators move to reassure the public that theyre addressing the failures. Kirsten Aiken presents a Business Summer Special.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: News Breakfast: Extended
programme.desc: An extended News Breakfast over summer, as Emma Rebellato and Olivia Caisley bring you the mornings top stories and interviews, joined by Luke Siddham Dundon with news, Johnson Raela with sport and Claudia Long on weather.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ruby Cornish brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Compass
programme.desc: Follow Sydneys Yes In My Backyard movement on their quest to change attitudes on housing. With Sydney on track to become a city with no grandchildren, YIMBYs are fighting for the right to shelter and the future of their city.

programme.title: ABC News Summer
programme.desc: Joe OBrien presents the latest from ABC News, following todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport and weather you need across the summer holidays.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Jade Barker brings you the latest news and comprehensive coverage of the days top stories from across Australia and around the globe.

programme.title: ABC News Summer
programme.desc: The latest from ABC News, following todays top stories plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport and weather you need across the summer holidays. Presented by Lexy Hamilton-Smith live from Brisbane.

programme.title: 7.30 Special
programme.desc: More of 7.30s highlights from 2025: Norman Swan investigates microplastics in our homes. Plus Sarah Ferguson interviews American poet, writer and professor Ocean Vuong.

programme.title: Culture By Design
programme.desc: Design is a reflection of history, heritage and identity. This episode explores cultural roots that influence modern design with a wood block printer in Bangalore, fashion designer in Jakarta and furniture designer in Mumbai.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent
programme.desc: In the Indian state of Bihar, the worlds largest "prohibition experiment" is taking place. Booze was banned to curb high rates of domestic violence, but its resulted in a thriving bootleg industry with deadly consequences.

programme.title: Chopsticks Or Fork?
programme.desc: Gary Bong took the reins at Oriental Palace 20 years ago, keeping alive the family tradition of cooking Malaysian Chinese food for their community. Garys specialities include Char Kway Teo and Chefs Duck.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Regional Roundup
programme.desc: Live export bans expected to drive up the cost of lamb, a sky high view of Australias breathtaking backyard that youll have to see to believe, and meet the pair of rodeo young guns having a crack at the big time in the US.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: Start your day with the latest overnight developments, breaking news and the days top stories. Emma Rebellato and Olivia Caisley bring you news and interviews, joined by Luke Siddham Dundon, Johnson Raela and Claudia Long.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you updated news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Johanna Nicholson.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Johanna Nicholson brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter.

programme.title: Compass
programme.desc: Sam Mostyn, a modern and optimistic Governor-General, advocates daily for a "culture of care". On the eve of her first year in office, she speaks with Geraldine Doogue.

programme.title: ABC News Summer
programme.desc: Joe OBrien presents the latest from ABC News, following todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport and weather you need across the summer holidays.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Craig Smart brings you the latest news and comprehensive coverage of the days top stories from across Australia and around the globe.

programme.title: ABC News Summer
